title: Use Markdown Structure
description: Gemini parses and responds well to markdown
rule: Use markdown formatting (## headers, - bullet points, **bold**, numbered lists) to structure your prompts. Gemini understands and follows markdown structure effectively.
examples:
## Context
You are a data analyst.

## Task
Analyze the following data:

## Data
```
{data}
```

## Output Requirements
- Key insights
- Trends
- Recommendations

title: Provide Concrete Examples
description: Ground prompts with specific, real scenarios
rule: Include concrete examples with specific details rather than abstract descriptions. Gemini performs better when given grounded, real-world scenarios to work with.
examples:
Instead of: 'Write a business email'

Use: 'Write a business email from a project manager at a tech startup, informing the team about a 2-week deadline extension for the mobile app launch, explaining that QA testing revealed critical bugs.'

title: List Requirements Explicitly
rule: Format requirements as a numbered checklist: '1. Must include X, 2. Should avoid Y, 3. Format as Z.' Be explicit about all constraints and expectations.
examples:
Requirements:
1. Response must be under 200 words
2. Include at least 3 specific examples
3. Use professional tone
4. Format as bullet points
5. Do not include technical jargon

title: Position Critical Content Strategically
description: Place important information at key positions
rule: Put the most important context and instructions at the beginning and end of long prompts. Information in the middle may receive less attention (the 'lost in the middle' effect).

title: Decompose Complex Tasks
rule: Break complex requests into sequential subtasks: 'First, analyze X. Then, based on your analysis, do Y. Finally, synthesize your findings into Z.'
examples:
Complete this task in three steps:

Step 1: Read the provided research papers and identify the main methodology used in each.

Step 2: Compare the methodologies and identify similarities and differences.

Step 3: Write a synthesis paragraph summarizing which methodology is most appropriate for our use case.

title: Specify Audience and Tone
description: Define who the response is for
rule: Explicitly state the target audience and tone: 'Explain this for a 5th grader' or 'Write this for a technical audience familiar with ML.' This adjusts vocabulary and depth appropriately.

title: Use System Instructions Effectively
description: Leverage system instructions for consistent behavior
rule: Place persistent instructions (role, tone, constraints that apply to all messages) in the system instruction rather than repeating them in each prompt.
